content: Write a song about a lonely astronaut stranded on Mars, longing for Earth but also marveling at the beauty of space.

(Verse 1)
In the silence of the Martian sky,
Where the red dust whispers lullabies,
I'm a lone astronaut, miles away,
From the world that I used to sway.

Chorus:
Oh, Earth, you're a distant memory,
A blue gem in the cosmic sea.
I'm marooned on this rusty sphere,
But in solitude, I find allure.

(Verse 2)
Gazing at the stars above,
Each one a world of its own, I believe.
The Milky Way stretches wide,
A tapestry that captures my pride.

Chorus:
Yet, Earth, you're a beacon so bright,
Guiding me through the endless night.
Though I'm trapped on this alien land,
Your love is the fuel in my hand.

(Bridge)
The rover plies the barren terrain,
Each rock and dune, a new domain.
I take solace in every sunrise,
Painting the sky with hues so nice.

(Verse 3)
Mars may be cold and desolate,
But in its embrace, I'm not late.
To explore, to discover, to see,
What lies beyond just you and me.

Chorus:
Earth, you're the home in my heart,
Where loved ones wait to start.
But Mars, you're the challenge, the test,
Of human spirit, expressed.

(Outro)
So here's to the astronauts of old,
Who paved the way, bold and cold.
And to those who'll follow in my suit,
Exploring the universe, without a boot.

Earth, though you're far, I won't forget,
For in space, I've found a new set
Of wonders to cherish and hold dear,
As I stare into the cosmic sphere.
